intro: Ornithogalum arabicum var. algeriense, commonly known as Algerian star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous root system and grass-like foliage. The plant produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is often cultivated in arid regions.
